revision.comment: Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/116.58.200.132|116.58.200.132]] ([[User talk:116.58.200.132|talk]]) to last revision by Jimbo Wales. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
{{talk header}} {{User:MiszaBot/config | algo = old(30d) | archive = Talk:Parthian Empire/Archive %(counter)d | counter = 1 | maxarchivesize = 150K | archiveheader = {{Automatic archive navigator}} }} {{ArticleHistory |action1=FAC |action1date=19:53, 25 May 2010 |action1link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Parthian Empire/archive1 |action1result=promoted |action1oldid=363869268 |currentstatus=FA |maindate=11 July 2011 }} {{Vital article|level=4|topic=History|class=FA}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|collapsed=yes|1= {{WikiProject Military History|class=FA|Classical=y|Middle-Eastern=y}} {{WikiProject Iran|class=FA|importance=Top}} {{WikiProject Classical Greece and Rome|class=FA|importance=Top}} {{WikiProject Rome|class=FA|importance=High}} {{WikiProject Armenia|class=FA|importance=high}} {{WikiProject Georgia (country)|class=FA|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Caucasia|class=FA|importance=High}} {{WikiProject Azerbaijan|class=FA|importance=high}} {{WikiProject Iraq|class=FA|importance=high}} {{WikiProject Syria|class=FA|importance=high}} {{WikiProject Ancient Near East|class=FA|importance=high}} {{WikiProject European history|class=FA|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Former countries|class=FA |B-Class-1=yes |B-Class-2=yes |B-Class-3=yes |B-Class-4=yes |B-Class-5=yes}} }} == Map == I found a new map of Parthian at [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:LocationParthia.PNG] that is more clear on the location of the Empire and shows its borders imposed on modern day countries. It is easier to follow than the current map that is difficult to see the extent of territories. Should we switch to this map? == Flag/standard == Tertullian describes the Parthian flag as an image of the sun. evidence for this is: (Apologeticum, 16). Because of this I think it would be right to use this file: Sun of Mithras (standard).png, as the flag of the Parthian empire. If anyone agrees then add the image as the flag, with Apologeticum 16 as the reference [[User:History of Persia|History of Persia]] ([[User talk:History of Persia|talk]]) 21:00, 9 July 2015 (UTC) I [[User:History of Persia|History of Persia]] ([[User talk:History of Persia|talk]]) 21:00, 9 July 2015 (UTC) :[[Tertullian]] might not be a reliable source as he is a Christian apologist from the ancient world, and texts like his are usually considered primary sources. We look for reliable scholarship that is secondary sources. Check [[WP:RS]] for a description of reliable sourcing. [[User:Ogress|'''Ogress''']] [[User_Talk:Ogress|''smash!'']] 21:11, 9 July 2015 (UTC) ::I posted this reply not three hours ago and you ignored it and replaced the flag with the edit summary, "no one is discussing this on the talk page". [[User:Ogress|'''Ogress''']] [[User_Talk:Ogress|''smash!'']] 00:33, 10 July 2015 (UTC) ::[[Kaveh Farrokh|Farrokh]] is a college counselor with NO training as an academic historian(notice it says he is a '''writer'''). Farrokh is not a reliable source since he is not a historian. Tertullian is a primary source and I seriously question exactly how he would know what a Parthian flag looks like, since he lived in Carthage! Pity you can not understand that! I noticed you couldn't provide a link for the "Tertullian source". Typical of a POV pusher that you continue to edit war, despite being reverted by two editors. --[[User:Kansas Bear|Kansas Bear]] ([[User talk:Kansas Bear|talk]]) 01:32, 10 July 2015 (UTC) ::What chapter and page of Tertullian's ''Apologeticum'' did you find this information? --[[User:Kansas Bear|Kansas Bear]] ([[User talk:Kansas Bear|talk]]) 01:58, 10 July 2015 (UTC) [[File:Vexillum-Pushkin Museum of Fine Arts.png|thumb|The only extant Roman [[vexillum]], 3rd century AD. [[Pushkin Museum of Fine Arts]], Russia.]] :::Aside from Tertullian and Kaveh Farrokh being unreliable sources, even Farrokh himself speaks of this "flag" as a battle standard, otherwise known as a [[battle ensign]], representing the deity Mithras (Merh). A battle ensign is NOT a [[national flag]]. No such thing existed in ancient times; national flags are an invention of the early modern era (18th, 19th centuries). I had a lengthy debate with someone about this in the talk page for the Chinese [[Qing dynasty]], and I would direct others there without having to repeat the same points. Look to the image on your right: this is a Roman [[vexillum]], a battle ensign used by the Romans. It would be equally preposterous to assume the Romans viewed such a thing as a "national flag" representing the Roman Empire. [[User:PericlesofAthens|Pericles of Athens]][[User talk:PericlesofAthens|Talk]] 18:57, 10 July 2015 (UTC) == Addressing the info-box map! == So recently I noticed that the map that I made and uploaded two years ago somehow turned green when it was originally red. ''(I have NO idea how that happened btw cause I didn't do it.)'' Now I was thinking of reverting the color of the map back to Red, but at the same time, I would like a consensus on the matter rather than simply reverting the map back it's original color off the bat. Do you all want me to revert the color of the map back to Red? OR do you all want the map to stay green? Red = Original color! Green = Current color! [[User:Keeby101|Kirby]] ([[User talk:Keeby101|talk]]) 00:38, 27 October 2015 (UTC) == Requested move 12 March 2016 ==
:''The following is a closed discussion of a [[WP:requested moves|requested move]]. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on the talk page. Editors desiring to contest the closing decision should consider a [[Wikipedia:move review|move review]]. No further edits should be made to this section. '' The result of the move request was: '''Not moved''' {{rmnac}}  — [[User:Amakuru|Amakuru]] ([[User talk:Amakuru|talk]]) 11:12, 18 March 2016 (UTC) ---- [[:Parthian Empire]] → {{no redirect|Arsacid Empire}} – Hi, I suggest to change the title of the article to '''Arsacid Empire''' which is more native and more precise name for this Iranian empire. [[User:Aidepikiwnirotide|Aidepikiwnirotide]] ([[User talk:Aidepikiwnirotide|talk]]) 18:36, 10 March 2016 (UTC) *'''Oppose''' Academically correct, but not at all familiar in general English usage. fails [[WP:COMMONNAME]]. [[User:Johnbod|Johnbod]] ([[User talk:Johnbod|talk]]) 04:18, 13 March 2016 (UTC) *'''Comment''' The page was moved to its current title as a result of an [[#Requested move|earlier discussion]]. [[User:Clpo13|clpo13]]([[User_talk:Clpo13|talk]]) 05:23, 13 March 2016 (UTC) *'''Oppose''' per previous discussion that move it here. I have heard of it as the Parthian Empire not the Arsacid Empire. Native name is not consider a better name for an article as it is to serve the reader thus common names are suppose to be used unless disambiguation is needed. --[[User:Spshu|Spshu]] ([[User talk:Spshu|talk]]) 16:30, 14 March 2016 (UTC) *'''Oppose''' per common name, as above. [[User:Egsan Bacon|Egsan Bacon]] ([[User talk:Egsan Bacon|talk]]) 17:09, 15 March 2016 (UTC) ---- :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of a [[Wikipedia:Requested moves|requested move]]. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on this talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Move review|move review]]. No further edits should be made to this section.
== Map == {{hat|Section redacted at request of Arman ad60. The issue appears to me moot and settled now anyway.--[[User:Jimbo Wales|Jimbo Wales]] ([[User talk:Jimbo Wales|talk]]) 17:58, 24 May 2016 (UTC)}} [[File:Parthian Empire 248 - 224 BC.png|thumb|Parthian empire|250px]] I want to include this map in the article. If you editors are watching, what do you think about that?[[User:Arman ad60|Arman ad60]] ([[User talk:Arman ad60|talk]]) 18:18, 3 April 2016 (UTC) :Sorry but the current map is far better. Your map mixes old names and modern frontiers without a clear indication of what is what. For article maps, simplicity is the key. [[User:UCaetano|UCaetano]] ([[User talk:UCaetano|talk]]) 08:53, 4 April 2016 (UTC) ::Well, my map is graphically very improved and more detailed than the previous one. Well "Quality" is also an important thing here isn't it. You have said about the borders of the modern countries. There are maps likes that of other empires, For example: [[Saffarid dynasty|Saffarid empire]], [[Samanid empire]], [[Ghaznavids|Ghaznavid empire]]. So, can't my map be accepted for this article?[[User:Arman ad60|Arman ad60]] ([[User talk:Arman ad60|talk]]) 10:36, 4 April 2016 (UTC) ::: No, it isn't an improvement. Just because better maps don't exist for those other articles, doesn't mean we should use a lower quality for this one. [[User:UCaetano|UCaetano]] ([[User talk:UCaetano|talk]]) 11:03, 4 April 2016 (UTC) Sorry, I think this map is better than the previous one, because it is graphically better and more detailed. I want to know what the other editors think about that. [[User:Arman ad60|Arman ad60]] ([[User talk:Arman ad60|talk]]) 11:45, 4 April 2016 (UTC) : If a majority of other editors support reverting to the map you're proposing, I'd have no issue in doing it. Until then, there's no new consensus, and the current map stays. [[User:UCaetano|UCaetano]] ([[User talk:UCaetano|talk]]) 12:13, 4 April 2016 (UTC) It doesn't have to be one or the other. The proposed map has some advantages: # Showing the neighbouring entities # Showing the relation to modern day countries # Showing important cities the disadvantages are: # Mixing the above in one map # Would be better as an SVG rather than png # AD and BC should be caps - or better still left off the map, the caption can carry this info # I would not use the inset box, the geography of the region is pretty well known. Conversely the Infobox map is very simple, which is good for its role there. I would like, ideally, to see a series of maps that show the empire at different stages and dates, with appropriate contemporary features, cities, neighbours, battle sites, commerce routes, depending on the historical narrative, and a separate map showing just the empire as it relates to the modern world. The map in the infobox, should I think, remain, though I would have no objection to unifying the colouring and layout. All the best: ''[[User:Rich Farmbrough|Rich]] [[User talk:Rich Farmbrough|Farmbrough]]'', 13:25, 4 April 2016 (UTC).
:Also note that [[:File:Parther reich.jpg]] is in German, which would be a good item to fix. All the best: ''[[User:Rich Farmbrough|Rich]] [[User talk:Rich Farmbrough|Farmbrough]]'', 13:30, 4 April 2016 (UTC).
::If someone also would expand the eastern part of the this map [[:File:Parther reich.jpg]] so it resembles the eastern border of the current map on the article, that would be perfection. --[[User:HistoryofIran|HistoryofIran]] ([[User talk:HistoryofIran|talk]]) 13:37, 4 April 2016 (UTC) ::there are problems, but also advantages, with this map. The caption is wrong - it clearly doesn't show the empire over its full period. It needs to be explained that the modern borders are also shown, but this is very useful. I'm bewildered by RF's claim that "the geography of the region is pretty well known" - to most non-locals it remains very obscure. We need not remove another map, and is not right for the infobox. [[User:Johnbod|Johnbod]] ([[User talk:Johnbod|talk]]) 17:02, 4 April 2016 (UTC) :::Not my intent to bewilder. I mean that people know that this area is at the juncture of Europe, Asia and Africa, that the bodies of water are the Med, the Persian Gulf, and the Red Sea, even if they cannot name the Caspian and Black Seas. :::Certainly if a historical map is overlaid with Egypt, Israel, Jordan, Syria etc. to provide context, it is reasonable to assume that the context itself does not require context. :::All the best: ''[[User:Rich Farmbrough|Rich]] [[User talk:Rich Farmbrough|Farmbrough]]'', 19:55, 4 April 2016 (UTC).
My map may have many problems. But first let me know one thing. What about the "quality" of the maps. I think my map is graphically a significant improvement. The previous one looks like a "childish hand-made map". In terms of quality, which one do you think is better? [[User:Arman ad60|Arman ad60]] ([[User talk:Arman ad60|talk]]) 17:58, 4 April 2016 (UTC) ::::I like the current one more more, since 'your' map has too many errors which has already been mentioned. --[[User:HistoryofIran|HistoryofIran]] ([[User talk:HistoryofIran|talk]]) 20:22, 4 April 2016 (UTC) OK, I have presented two more maps here. What do you think about them: [[File:LocationParthia.PNG|thumb|none]] [[File:Map Parthian Empire-fr.png|thumb|none]] : Not only the current map is still better, but none of the 3 maps you presented agree with each other on the boundaries. [[User:UCaetano|UCaetano]] ([[User talk:UCaetano|talk]]) 09:37, 5 April 2016 (UTC) {{hab}}
